alert.note: Alert for Merced (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 04 at 8:34AM PDT until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Merced River at Stevinson affecting Merced County. For the Merced River...at Stevinson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Merced River at Stevinson. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 70.5 feet, Water is up to the maintenance building in Hagaman Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 71.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning and continue rising to 71.0 feet late this morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 71.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 70.5 feet on 03/21/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Location Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am PDT) -------- Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Merced River Stevinson 71.0 71.0 Tue 8 am PDT 71.0 71.0 71.0 &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning by 900 AM PDT.
